definition: lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: The opportunity for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to recover has gone.
sentences.chinese: “两房”想咸鱼翻身的机会已经没有了。

sentences.english: Can Mr Brown reverse the dynamics?

definition: the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
bitterness finishes, sweetness begins (idiom); the hard times are over, the good times just beginning
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
